node.title: Canberra price rises push houses out of reach of first-time buyers, despite government aid
node.alt: A woman in a dress plays with a white dog and a ball in a backyard.
node.description: New buyers say a federal scheme that is meant to help them enter the property market is effectively redundant, as its cap of $500,000 is too low.
node.content:
["Would-be first-home buyer Steph Phillips says the\u00a0search for an affordable house in Canberra's supercharged market has almost defeated her.", "The 26-year-old did not realise it\u00a0but, at the exact moment she was telling the ABC about her house-hunting struggle, a property in the suburb she rents in was being auctioned off for $1,445,000.", "Ms\u00a0Phillips, a physiotherapist, said her quest for a \"forever home\" had become \"stressful and probably unreachable\".", "She\u00a0and her fiance, a school teacher, had considered leaving the ACT to find a place for them and their dog.", "She felt she must choose between a wedding or a house, \"because it's kind of like you can't have both\".", "Either way, Ms Phillips believed she would be stuck\u00a0renting for years.\u00a0", "
Aid scheme's $500,000 limit 'not plausible'
", "", "
The ACT's median property price rose 22.5 per cent in the year to September.(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "Canberra property prices are rising faster than those in most Australian cities.", "Data firm CoreLogic says the value of the median ACT dwelling shot up 22.5 per cent in the year to September. Canberra's house and unit prices are now second only to Sydney's.", "This boom is also pushing a federal government scheme to help first-time buyers into redundancy \u2014 at least for those seeking houses.", "The scheme allows\u00a0people like Ms Phillips to purchase property with a deposit as small as 5 per cent of the value, while avoiding the extra costs of\u00a0mortgage insurance.", "However, in the ACT, this deposit guarantee is capped at properties\u00a0priced under $500,000. Just over 200 Canberrans a year have been able to access it.", "Ms\u00a0Phillips said the cap,\u00a0which has not changed over the past two years, defied the reality of the ACT market.", "
Plenty of apartments qualify for scheme
", "An ABC analysis of 25,800\u00a0Canberra property purchases found more than a quarter of the sales in 2020-21 would have qualified for the first-home buyer's deposit scheme.", "However, 82.5 per cent of those sales were for apartments, and most of the rest were for land \u2014 meaning the buyers would need to source even more funds to build a house.", "Just one in 10 houses or blocks of land sold in 2020-21 was priced below the threshold.", "Stephen Koukoulas, of Market Economics,\u00a0said the scheme was useful because the lack of a deposit was one of the biggest barriers facing first-home buyers.", "\"However, the threshold has been set at such a low rate in the ACT that it has excluded many properties that are in\u00a0the market,\" he added.", "Nonetheless, he did not believe the cap should be increased, as that would likely inflate prices further and squeeze out other borrowers from accessing finance.", "Mr Koukoulas said ACT prices were surging because its labour market, with many government workers, had enjoyed more resilience across the pandemic, allowing Canberrans to take advantage of low interest rates.", "However, that was unlikely to last in the medium term, particularly if the city's busy construction activity outpaced the ACT's sluggish population growth.", "
New buyers reconsider life plans amid price surge
", "", "
Nurse May Florez struggles to see how she can buy a home and start a family.(ABC News: Simon Beardsell)
", "In the meantime, Canberrans like 31-year-old May Florez and her husband are reconsidering their property plans.", "The newlyweds are living in a share house in the town centre of Woden while searching for a home to buy.", "Ms Florez, a nurse,\u00a0said their budget allowed them to spend up to $650,000.", "\"But if you want to buy a house, it's going to be like $1 million. It's crazy actually,\" she\u00a0said.", "Ms Florez said it was difficult to balance buying a home with her plan to start a family.", "\"I think it's much easier to have a baby when you have your own house, because currently we're living in a share house,\" she said.", "\"But I think if house prices continue to increase, we'll just have the baby first.\""]
